required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Evaluation of the Summer EBT for Children Demonstration
clinical_study.official_title: The Evaluation of the Summer Electronic Benefits for Children Demonstration

brief_summary.textblock: The Summer Electronic Benefit for Children (SEBTC) demonstration provided food assistance to households with school-aged children during the summer through electronic benefit transfer (EBT) procedures used by the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants and Children (WIC) programs. The evaluation design included two components: an impact study and an implementation study. The evaluation assessed the impact of SEBTC on children's food security and nutritional status, household food expenditures and purchasing behaviors, parental perceptions, and participation in nutrition assistance programs. The implementation study analyzed SEBTC use patterns using administrative data, and described demonstration implementation and costs.

detailed_description.textblock: The SEBTC evaluation took place in the summers of 2011 through 2014. Ten grantees implemented the demonstration in a total of 16 sites; the number of participating sites and/or the evaluation components differed by year. In 2011, 5 grantees with five sites participated and the evaluation included implementation and cost analysis, EBT analysis, and an impact study. In 2012, 10 grantees implemented SEBTC in 14 sites and the evaluation included the same study components. In 2013, four grantees with six sites participated and the study components included EBT analysis and an impact study (no implementation or cost data collection). Finally, in 2014, three grantees participated in three sites and only implementation data were collected. Information on human subjects was collected for the evaluation's impact evaluation.

primary_outcome.measure: Very low food security among children according to the U.S. Household Food Security Survey Module, 30-day reference period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
primary_outcome.description: The food intake of any child in the household is reduced and their normal eating patterns are disrupted because the household lacks money and other resources for food

secondary_outcome.measure: Food insecurity among children according to the U.S. Household Food Security Survey Module, 30-day reference period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Any child in the household experienced very low food security or experienced reduced quality, variety, or desirability of diet.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Average daily cup equivalents of fruit and vegetables

secondary_outcome.measure: Children's fruit and vegetable consumption without fried potatoes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Average daily cup equivalents of fruit and vegetables, excluding fried potatoes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Average daily consumption of whole grains (in ounces)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Average daily dairy consumption cup equivalents

secondary_outcome.measure: Children's consumption of low- and non-fat milk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Any milk consumed was low- or non-fat

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Average daily consumption of added sugars (in teaspoons)

secondary_outcome.measure: Children's consumption of added sugars excluding cereals
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Average daily consumption of added sugars excluding cereals (in teaspoons)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
secondary_outcome.description: Average daily consumption of sugars (in teaspoons) from sugar-sweetened beverages

other_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
other_outcome.description: Household participation in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program

other_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
other_outcome.description: Household participation in the Special Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program for Women, Infants and Children

other_outcome.time_frame: Between 30 and 120 days after SEBTC benefits were issued
other_outcome.description: Total food expenditures from all sources (e.g., cash, SNAP, SEBTC)

arm_group.description: Households received $60 per summer month when school was not in session for each eligible child (Summers 2011-2013).
Households received $30 per summer month when school was not in session for each eligible child (Summer 2013 only).
Households with eligible children were not issued SEBTC benefits (Summers 2011 and 2012)

intervention.description: SEBTC benefits were issued on EBT cards using either the existing EBT delivery systems for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) or Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program for Women Infants and Children (WIC). Sites selected only one of the two EBT systems to be used to implement SEBTC prior to random assignment; households were not randomized to a specific delivery system.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Households with children who were certified to receive the National School Lunch program or the School Breakfast Program in the prior school year in participating sites, Summers 2011-2013

patient_data.ipd_description: Contract deliverables include restricted and public use data sets
